</ul>

<h4>0.8.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Use load_plugin_textdomain instead of load_textdomain</li>
<li>Fixed js/css links if symbolic links are used</li>
<li>Changed experimental WPMU support to experimental WP multisite support</li>
<li>Try curl() before fopen() to avoid an <a href="http://wordpress.org/support/topic/plugin-wp-piwik-problems-reaching-an-ssl-installation-of-piwiki">OpenSSL bug</a></li>
<li>Added Norwegian language file by Gormer</li>
<li>Don't worry - new features will follow soon ;)</li>
</ul>

<li>Some facelifting</li>
<li>Some minor bugfixes</li>
</ul>

<li>Language updates</li>
</ul>

<h4>0.2.0</h4>

<ul>
<li>First public version</li>
</ul>";s:3:"faq";s:3660:"<h4>Where can I find the Piwik URL and the Piwik auth token?</h4>

<p>To use this plugin you will need your own Piwik instance. If you do not already have a Piwik setup, you have two simple options: use either <a href="http://piwik.org/">Self-hosted</a> or <a href="http://piwik.org/hosting/">Cloud-hosted</a>.</p>

<p>As soon as Piwik works, you'll be able to configure WP-Piwik: The Piwik URL is the same URL you use to access your Piwik, e.g. for the demo site: <a href="http://demo.piwik.org" rel="nofollow">http://demo.piwik.org</a>. The auth token is some kind of a secret password, which allows WP-Piwik to get the necessary data from Piwik. To get your auth token, log in to Piwik, click at your user name (top right) and click at "API" (left sidebar menu).</p>

<p>You can get a more detailed description here: <a href="https://piwik.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/" rel="nofollow">https://piwik.org/blog/2015/05/wordpress-integration-wp-piwik-1-0/</a></p>

<h4>I get this message: "WP-Piwik was not able to connect to Piwik using our configuration". How to proceed?</h4>

<p>First, please make sure your configuration is valid, e.g., if you are using the right Piwik URL (see description above). Then, go to the "Support" tab and run the test script. This test script will try to get some information from Piwik and shows the full response. Usually, the response output gives a clear hint what's wrong:</p>

<p>The response output contains...
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 403 Forbidden</strong>: WP-Piwik is not allowed to connect to Piwik. Please check your Piwik server's configuration. Maybe you are using a password protection via .htaccess or you are blocking requests from localhost/127.0.0.1. If you aren&#8217;t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and <strong>HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found</strong>: The Piwik URL is wrong. Try to copy &#38; paste the URL you use to access Piwik itself via browser.
* <strong>bool(false)</strong> and no further HTTP response code: The Piwik server does not respond. Very often, this is caused by firewall or mod_security settings. Check your server logfiles to get further information. If you aren&#8217;t sure about this, please contact your web hoster for support.</p>

<h4>Can I contribute to WP-Piwik as a translator?</h4>

<p>You like to contribute to WP-Piwik translations? Please use the <a href="https://www.transifex.com/projects/p/wp-piwik/">Transifex translation community</a>.</p>

<p>Of course, I will add missing languages if requested, and I will also upload the existing language files of older WP-Piwik releases.</p>

<p>If you can't (or don not want to) use transifex, you can also translate languages/wp-piwik.pot delivered with WP-Piwik.</p>

<p>Thank you very much! :-)</p>

<h4>Why does WP-Piwik require a newer PHP version than WordPress?</h4>

<p>WP-Piwik requires a working Piwik instance which requires a higher PHP version, too. Furthermore, please have a look at the <a href="http://php.net/eol.php">official PHP Unsupported Branches page</a>. Even if your software still works with PHP 5.2, the PHP team stopped to deliver <strong>security</strong> patches in January 2011. Even PHP 5.3 does not get security patches anymore (end of life date was August 2014).</p>

<h4>Tracking does not work on HostGator!</h4>

<p>Try to enable the "avoid mod_security" option (WP-Piwik settings, Tracking tab) or create a mod_security whitelist.</p>

<h4>Overview shortcode shows no unique visitors using a yearly range.</h4>

<p>See <a href="http://piwik.org/faq/how-to/#faq_113">Piwik FAQ</a>.</p>";}s:17:"short_description";s:87:"This plugin adds a Piwik stats site to your WordPress or WordPress multisite dashboard.";s:13:"download_link";s:58:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/wp-piwik.1.0.14.zip";s:4:"tags";a:5:{s:9:"analytics";s:9:"analytics";s:5:"piwik";s:5:"piwik";s:10:"statistics";s:10:"statistics";s:5:"stats";s:5:"stats";s:8:"tracking";s:8:"tracking";}s:11:"donate_link";s:81:"https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&#038;hosted_button_id=6046779";s:5:"icons";a:2:{s:2:"2x";s:55:"//ps.w.org/wp-piwik/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1236622";s:2:"1x";s:55:"//ps.w.org/wp-piwik/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1236622";}}s:30:"google-analytics-for-wordpress";O:8:"stdClass":22:{s:4:"name";s:35:"Google Analytics by MonsterInsights";s:4:"slug";s:30:"google-analytics-for-wordpress";s:7:"version";s:5:"5.5.4";s:6:"author";s:62:"<a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/">MonsterInsights</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:35:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/smub";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:9:"chriscct7";s:40:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/chriscct7";s:4:"smub";s:35:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/smub";}s:8:"requires";s:3:"3.9";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.6.2";s:13:"compatibility";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";d:76;s:11:"num_ratings";s:3:"371";s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;s:3:"238";i:4;s:2:"20";i:3;s:2:"12";i:2;s:2:"21";i:1;s:2:"80";}s:10:"downloaded";i:12768227;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2016-10-19 6:36am GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-09-14";s:8:"homepage";s:135:"https://www.monsterinsights.com/pricing/#utm_source=wordpress&#038;utm_medium=plugin&#038;utm_campaign=wpgaplugin&#038;utm_content=v504";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:5203:"<h4>Google Analytics Plugin for WordPress</h4>

<p>The Google Analytics for WordPress by MonsterInsights allows you to track your blog easily and always stays up to date with the newest features in Google Analytics.</p>

<p>MonsterInsights is the most popular Google Analytics plugin for WordPress with roughly 11 million downloads.</p>

<blockquote>
  <p><strong>Upgrade to MonsterInsights Premium</strong><br />
  If you need support or want to use custom dimensions, upgrade to <a href="https://monsterinsights.com/pricing/?utm_source=wporg&#38;utm_medium=readme&#38;utm_campaign=wpgaplugin" rel="friend">Google Analytics by MonsterInsights Pro today!</a></p>
</blockquote>

<p>Full list of features:</p>

<ul>
<li>Simple installation through integration with Google Analytics API: authenticate, select the site you want to track and you're done.</li>
<li>This plugin uses the universal or the asynchronous Google Analytics tracking code, the fastest and most reliable tracking code Google Analytics offers.</li>
<li>Gives you incredibly nice visitor metric dashboards right in your WordPress install.</li>
<li>Option to enable demographics and interest reports.</li>
<li>Outbound link &#38; downloads tracking.

<ul>
<li>Configurable options to track outbound links either as pageviews or as events.</li>
<li>Option to track just downloads as pageviews or events in Google Analytics.</li>
<li>Option to track internal links with a particular format as outbound links, very useful for affiliate links that start with /out/, for instance.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Possibility to ignore any user level and up, so all editors and higher for instance.</li>
<li>Option to anonymize IP's for use in countries with stricter privacy regulations.</li>
<li>Tracking of your search result pages and 404 pages.</li>
<li>Full <a href="http://yoast.com/google-analytics-debug-mode/">debug mode</a>, including Firebug lite and ga_debug.js for debugging Google Analytics issues.
&#62; <strong>Development on GitHub</strong><br />
&#62; The development of Google Analytics by MonsterInsights <a href="https://github.com/Yoast/google-analytics-for-wordpress">takes place on GitHub</a>. Bugs and pull requests are welcomed there. For support, you have two options: either <a href="https://monsterinsights.com/pricing/?utm_source=wporg&#38;utm_medium=readme&#38;utm_campaign=wpgaplugin" rel="friend">buy the premium version of Google Analytics by MonsterInsights</a>, this will give you access to our support team, or refer to the forums.</li>
</ul>

<h4>Note for Beginners</h4>

<p>Like all WordPress plugins, Google Analytics by MonsterInsights is only available for self-hosted WordPress sites. This means you will need to <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/wp-tutorials/how-to-properly-move-your-blog-from-wordpress-com-to-wordpress-org/" rel="friend" title="How to properly move from WordPress.com to WordPress.org">switch from WordPress.com to WordPress.org</a> if you want to use this plugin on your WordPress site.</p>

<p>For more details, see this infographic on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/self-hosted-wordpress-org-vs-free-wordpress-com-infograph/" rel="friend" title="Self Hosted WordPress.org vs Free WordPress.com">self hosted WordPress.org vs free WordPress.com</a></p>

<h4>Credits</h4>

<p>This plugin is created by <a href="https://twitter.com/chriscct7" rel="friend" title="Chris Christoff">Chris Christoff</a> and <a href="https://syedbalkhi.com/" rel="friend" title="Syed Balkhi">Syed Balkhi</a> with sponsorship from <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/" rel="friend" title="WPBeginner">WPBeginner</a>.</p>

<h4>What's Next</h4>

<p>If you like this plugin, then consider checking out our other projects:</p>

<ul>
<li><a href="http://optinmonster.com/" rel="friend" title="OptinMonster">OptinMonster</a> - Get More Email Subscribers</li>
<li><a href="http://soliloquywp.com/" rel="friend" title="Soliloquy">Soliloquy</a> - Best WordPress Slider Plugin</li>
<li><a href="http://enviragallery.com/" rel="friend" title="Envira Gallery">Envira Gallery</a> - Best WordPress Gallery Plugin</li>
<li><a href="https://wpforms.com/" rel="friend" title="WPForms">WPForms</a> - Best WordPress Contact Form Plugin</li>
</ul>

<p>This plugin would not be possible without the help and support of <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/" rel="friend" title="WPBeginner">WPBeginner</a>, the largest WordPress resource site. You can learn from our <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/category/wp-tutorials/" rel="friend" title="WordPress Tutorials">free WordPress Tutorials</a> like <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/how-to-install-wordpress/" rel="friend" title="How to Install WordPress - Step by Step">how to install WordPress</a>, <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/wordpress-hosting/" rel="friend" title="How to choose the best WordPress hosting">choose the best WordPress hosting</a>, <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/glossary/" rel="friend" title="WordPress Glossary Terms for Beginners">WordPress glossary</a>, and more.</p>

<p>You can also learn about other <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/category/plugins/" rel="friend" title="Best WordPress Plugins">best WordPress plugins</a>.</p>";s:12:"installation";s:705:"<ol>
<li>Install Google Analytics by MonsterInsights either via the WordPress.org plugin repository or by uploading the files to your server. (See instructions on <a href="http://www.wpbeginner.com/beginners-guide/step-by-step-guide-to-install-a-wordpress-plugin-for-beginners/" rel="friend">how to install a WordPress plugin</a>)</li>
<li>Activate Google Analytics by MonsterInsights.</li>
<li>Navigate to the Analytics tab in your admin menu and configure the plugin.</li>
<li>Want more features? <a href="https://monsterinsights.com/?utm_source=wporg&#38;utm_medium=readme&#38;utm_campaign=wpgaplugin" rel="friend" title="MonsterInsights">Purchase the premium version of MonsterInsights</a>!</li>

<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Add protection against blank profile ids</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.5.3</h4>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes issue with PHP compatibility scanner's bug</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>

</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.5.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: July 7th, 2016</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes compatibiltiy with upcoming Shiny Updates v2 in WP core</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Updates license manager to have more reliable update information including better compatibility with Yoast SEO products.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.5</h4>

<p>Release Date: May 1st, 2016</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes issue with changelog missing some deployed versions</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Add new System Info tab for faster support</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.9</h4>

<p>Release Date: April 15th, 2016</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes issue with eCommerce addon (also requires user to update eCommerce addon)</li>
<li>Fixes issue with 2 dashboard links</li>
<li>A bug in pre-existing code caused the menu of the plugin to skyrocket unintentionally. This has been corrected.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>New font based dashboard icon</li>
<li>The "MonsterInsights" menu item name has been renamed to just "Insights"</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.8</h4>

<p>Release Date: April 14th, 2016</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes compatibility issue with WordPress 4.5</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Annoucements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Google Analytics by Yoast is now MonsterInsights.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Adds ground work for new features coming soon.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.6</h4>

<p>Release Date: August 25th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixes the dashboard tables which were broken in WordPress 4.3 because of a new version of jQuery that was introduced.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.5</h4>

<p>Release Date: August 5th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Security:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a small stored XSS issue (only exploitable by admins), thanks <a href="https://twitter.com/tom_dxw">Tom Adams</a> from <a href="https://security.dxw.com/">dxw security</a> for responsibly disclosing the issue.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Only allows showing and saving the custom code field for users with the <code>unfiltered_html</code> capability.</li>
<li>Improves JavaScript output escaping on the frontend.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.4</h4>

<p>Release Date: July 21st, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li>Enhancements:

<ul>
<li>Makes sure core functionality is only loaded when needed, improving admin performance and preventing compatibility issues with the upcoming 2.3 release of Yoast SEO.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.3</h4>

<p>Release Date: July 15th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Improved form labels for remarketing / demographics and interests reports.</li>
<li>Improved the notice that is shown in the head to non-admin users when their usergroup has been excluded from tracking or debug mode is enabled.</li>
<li>Adds 4 translations: ca, en_AU, ja, pt_PT</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where the plugin would fetch a refresh token from Google on every page request.</li>
<li>Fixes an undefined index notice which was triggered when running WordPress using WP CLI.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: April 21th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where our link tracking broke the content in case of multiline links.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where it was no longer possible to dismiss the i18n module.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4.1</h4>

<p>Release Date: April 21th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where GA API was being pinged too often.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where users were unable to authenticate with Google Analytics. It might take a while for authentication to work again, as the API key within the plugin has to be within its quota limits again. We&#8217;re very sorry for the inconvenience. Note that for Premium users everything still works.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.4</h4>

<p>Release Date: April 20th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Complete technical overhaul of the way settings are being stored. Switched to WP Settings API and added input validation and sanitation for several settings.</li>
<li>Made the settings more accessible by adding <code>for</code> attributes to the labels, connecting them with the corresponding form fields. Props to <a href="https://github.com/steverep">Steve Repsher</a> for the awesome contribution!</li>
<li>Made Universal tracking the default for new installs.</li>
<li>Adds administrators to the default user roles to ignore for tracking.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Security:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes several security issues that were discovered during an elaborate security review performed by our friends from <a href="https://sucuri.net/">Sucuri</a>.</li>
<li>Fixes two other XSS issues. Thanks to <a href="https://github.com/schmittjoh">Johannes Schmitt</a> from <a href="https://scrutinizer-ci.com/">Scrutinizer CI</a> and <a href="http://klikki.fi">Jouko Pynn&#246;nen</a> for discovering and responsibly disclosing these issues.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes an issue where some GA dashboard style sheets and scripts were also loaded outside of the Google Analytics by Yoast dashboard, thereby unnecessarily slowing down the WP admin.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where a PHP warning could be raised on the dashboard when no data is available.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.3.3</h4>

<p>Release Date: March 19th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li>Several security fixes:

<ol>
<li>Fix minor XSS issue where admins could XSS each other through an unescaped manual UA field.</li>
<li>Fix stored XSS issue where changing a property's name in Google Analytics to contain malicious JS would allow execution of that JS in the admin as the profile name was not escaped properly.</li>
<li>Fix un-authenticated change of the GA profile list, allowing the previous XSS to become a slightly bigger issue. Issues 2 and 3 combined lead to a <a href="http://blog.sucuri.net/2015/03/understanding-wordpress-plugin-vulnerabilities.html">DREAD score</a> of 5.</li>
</ol></li>
<li>Other fixes:

<ul>
<li>Small code style improvements.</li>
<li>Throw an error and deactivate if either the PHP SPL or PHP filter libraries aren't loaded.</li>
<li>Introduced a filter <code>yst_ga_track_super_admin</code> to allow disabling of super admin tracking on multi-site, defaulting to true.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<p>Big thanks to <a href="http://klikki.fi">Jouko Pynn&#246;nen</a> for responsibly disclosing security issues #2 and #3.</p>

<h4>5.3.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: February 18th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Throws away the GA data when a user changes his GA profile.</li>
<li>Makes a few strings translatable that were not translatable yet.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes the "Missing class information" Zend error that was caused by our api-libs package.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.3.1</h4>

<p>Release Date: February 11th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Added a filter (<code>yst-ga-filter-api-end-date</code>) to enable our <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/">premium plugin</a> to show more recent data in the dashboards.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Features:</p>

<ul>
<li>Added <a href="https://support.google.com/analytics/answer/2558867">Enhanced link attribution</a> for Universal tracking.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes</p>

<ul>
<li><a href="https://github.com/markoheijnen/grunt-glotpress/pull/14">Fixes a bug</a> in the grunt task we use for downloading translations from GlotPress, which caused the translations to no longer be loaded.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where the links to our submenu pages were broken in case of a locale other than <code>en_US</code> being set.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.3</h4>

<p>Release Date: January 27th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Added an option for entirely disabling the dashboards functionality. If a user disables the dashboard, the menu item gets moved downward since there no longer is a reason for putting it so far up.</li>
<li>Improved performance by making sure everything is autoloaded correctly and removing class inclusion checks everywhere.</li>
<li>Makes sure the menu items become translatable.</li>
<li>Added a button to save the GA authentication code as an alternative to hitting the return button.</li>
<li>Format the page views number in the hover label of dashboards.</li>
<li>Reduced the number of results retrieved from the Google Analytics API per call from 10,000 to 1,000. This is filterable through <code>yst-ga-filter-api-limit</code>.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>When toggling checkbox the authentication token input was showing up.</li>
<li>Fixed internal links that were being tracked as outbound-article- (with trailing dash).</li>
<li>Makes sure re-authentication notice is only shown when authentication has actually failed.</li>
<li>Introduces a notice for when authentication isn't the problem but the plugin was somehow unable to fetch data from GA.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>i18n:</p>

<ul>
<li>Added translations for <code>da_DK</code>, <code>es_MX</code>, <code>fr_FR</code>, <code>it_IT</code>, <code>nb_NO</code>, <code>pl_PL</code>, <code>pt_BR</code>.</li>
<li>Updated translations for <code>en_GB</code>, <code>he_IL</code>, <code>nl_NL</code>, <code>ru_RU</code>.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.8</h4>

<p>Release Date: January 8th, 2015</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Makes sure reauthentication notice is only shown on the GA dashboard page.</li>
<li>Fixes a couple of situations in which the GA reauthentication notice was shown erroneously.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.7</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 18th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Increase timeout limit for request to Google API to prevent quickly session time-outs.</li>
<li>Setting SSL verifier to FALSE, to prevent checking SSL-chain.</li>
<li>Checking for cURL version 7.19, it this version is used the plugin switches to http streams.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Using webproperties instead of account names in the select box for choosing the Google Analytics profile.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.6</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 16th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Hotfix:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixing API library to prevent fatal error.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes the way of getting data from the Google API. cURL was used, but is changed into core wp_remote functionality to prevent errors when cURL isn't enabled.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.5</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 16th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>When deactivating the plugin the options with API-details will be cleared.</li>
<li>Show notice when the plugin isn't able to fetch data from Google for more than 48 hours.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes the way of getting data from the Google API. cURL was used, but is changed into core wp_remote functionality to prevent errors when cURL isn't enabled.</li>
<li>Using autoloader for Google OAuth libraries instead of require them immediately to prevent conflicts with already loaded files.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.4</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 15th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Enhancements:

<ul>
<li>Moved from OAuth1 to OAuth2 for Google Analytics API requests.</li>
<li>Open authentication and reauthentication for Google in a new window.</li>
<li>Force reloading of CSS and JS on version change of plugin.</li>
<li>Refactoring fetching profiles from Google Analytics</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.3</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 11th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>improved visual look and data representation for dashboard graphs, props <a href="https://github.com/Rarst/">Andrey Savchenko</a></li>
<li>when manual UA-code is selected, the profile selection gets disabled to clarify that the user is choosing an alternative to regular profile selection.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where GA profile was fetched with every admin request, resulting in a pile of unnecessary API requests.</li>
<li>Fixes a problem where GA started throttling API requests done by our plugin because there were too many. We now fetch the data only once a day from GA. For realtime data, users should go to Google Analytics.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 10th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where it was no longer possible to uncheck checkboxes in the settings.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where jQuery Chosen component was not rendered correctly on a hidden tab.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2.1</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 9th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Replaced jQuery Chosen library with latest version to enable optgroup search.</li>
<li>Shows a warning when configuring a manual UA-code that this will not work together with the dashboards functionality.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a 'headers already sent' warning.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where nothing was shown on the dashboards for setups with a manual UA-code. It now shows you a message that you need to authenticate with Google Analytics if you wish to make use of the dashboards feature.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 9th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Features:

<ul>
<li>Added a brand new GA dashboard:

<ul>
<li>Added graphs showing the sessions and bounce rates.</li>
<li>Added reporting tables showing top pages, traffic sources and countries.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.1.4</h4>

<p>Release Date: December 2nd, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Added GA property name to 'Analytics profile' selection in settings. Thanks <a href="https://github.com/stephenyeargin">stephenyeargin</a> for reporting.</li>
<li>Removed firebug lite as it's rather obsolete with todays development consoles.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>i18n:</p>

<ul>
<li>Several string fixes for easier translation.</li>
<li>Added en_GB and he_IL.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where site admins for sites on a multisite setup would receive a notice when visiting another site on the same setup which they didn't administrate, props <a href="https://github.com/nerrad">nerrad</a>.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where saving the admin settings would cause non-string form fields to be ignored or rejected.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.1.3</h4>

<p>Release Date: November 26th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Security fix: fixed a very minor cross site scripting issue with the manual UA code in de admin settings. The manual UA code is now sanitized before it is saved.</li>
</ul>

<h4>5.1.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: November 19th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Features:</p>

<ul>
<li>Added a new box promoting our translation site for non en_US users.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where links on the extension page where not pointing to the correct url.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.1.1</h4>

<p>Release Date: November 12th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a conflict with Fancybox.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where links without the href attribute would cause the tracking code to be added wrongly.</li>
<li>Fixes a multisite bug in Premium which was caused by the absence of a network admin menu.</li>
<li>Fixes an issue with the version number.</li>
<li>Fixes a bug where translations might be loaded several times.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Shows more relevant banners.</li>
<li>Adds an image to the premium extension on the extensions page.</li>
<li>Always show the custom dimension tab.</li>
<li>Added translations for Finnish, Dutch and Russian.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.1</h4>

<p>Release Date: October 30th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a possible JavaScript conflict within the tracking code.</li>
<li>Makes sure translations are loaded correctly.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Improved UX for help texts in form.</li>
<li>Added "Google Analytics by Yoast Premium" to the extensions page.</li>
<li>Makes sure the user returns to the original settings tab after saving.</li>
<li>Added a filter <code>wp_nav_menu</code> to enable tracking outbound links from the menu.</li>
<li>Added a filter <code>wp_list_bookmarks</code> to enable tracking for blogroll widgets.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.7</h4>

<p>Release Date: October 14th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixes a bug where 404 tracking would not work when using ga.js tracking.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Refactored several bits of code.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.6</h4>

<p>Release Date: September 17th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixed several notices.</li>
<li>Improved support for premium extensions to this plugin.</li>
<li>Fixed bug where on multi-site or subdirectory installs, settings wouldn't save.</li>
<li>Fix the tracking of downloads in ga.js tracking.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug where custom code would be output after the send pageview instead of before.</li>
<li>Fixed an empty delimiter warning.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Enhancements:</p>

<ul>
<li>Improved admin icon.</li>
<li>Added a filter <code>wpga_menu_on_top</code> which, when returned false, moves the analytics menu down.</li>
<li>Added filters <code>yoast-ga-push-array-ga-js</code> and <code>yoast-ga-push-array-universal</code> to filter the push arrays.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.5</h4>

<p>Release Date: September 4th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixes error in link parsing that would cause all sorts of display errors.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.4</h4>

<p>Release Date: September 4th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fix small error in GA setup error link.</li>
<li>Fix bug that would remove attributes from links.</li>
<li>Added Try/Catch around connect to Google Analytics to prevent uncaught exceptions.</li>
<li>Move require of function file to prevent error with already defined functions.</li>
<li>Fix bug that sometimes prevented saving user roles to be ignored.</li>
<li>Fix several notices.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Enhancements:

<ul>
<li>Add links to Settings page and Knowledge Base on plugins page.</li>
<li>No longer store result from Google API in the main option, saves memory on frontend.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.3</h4>

<p>Skipped due to error during release.</p>

<h4>5.0.2</h4>

<p>Release Date: September 4th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixed bug with outbound link tracking not properly escaping attributes.</li>
<li>Fixed bug that broke tracking with ga.js.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.1</h4>

<p>Release Date: September 4th, 2014</p>

<ul>
<li>Bugfixes:

<ul>
<li>Fixed string where array expected warning.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>5.0.0</h4>

<p>Release Date: September 4th, 2014</p>

<p>Complete rewrite of the Google Analytics plugin.</p>

<ul>
<li>Enhancements:

<ul>
<li>Universal tracking added</li>
<li>Better link tracking</li>
<li>New Universal demographics feature</li>
<li>New menu items in the WordPress admin menu</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.3.5</h4>

<ul>
<li>Enhancement:

<ul>
<li>Update banners in admin.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.3.4</h4>

<ul>
<li><p>Bugfix:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixed error in a database query as reported by <a href="http://wordpress.org/support/topic/wordpress-database-error-table-1">mikeotgaar</a> and applied some best practices for the database queries - props <a href="http://profiles.wordpress.org/jrf">Jrf</a>.</li>
<li>Fixed error in a database query.</li>
<li>Made check for customcode option more robust - props <a href="https://github.com/Rarst">Rarst</a>.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>i18n</p>

<ul>
<li>Updated gawp.pot file</li>
<li>Added de_DE, el_GR, es_ES, fi, fr_FR, hu_HU &#38; nl_NL</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.3.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix a possible fatal error in tracking.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.3.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Bugfix: Google Analytics crappy API output is different when you have a single GA account versus multiple. Annoying, but fixed now.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.3.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Removes a left over JS alert.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Major refactor of plugin code, to only load necessary code on front and backend.</li>
<li>Made entire plugin i18n ready.</li>
<li>Fixed Google Authentication process (thanks to <a href="http://www.janwillemeshuis.nl/">Jan Willem Eshuis</a>).</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.8</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix a small bug in tracking that could potentially slow down admin.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.7</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix to prevent far too agressive oAuth implementation from breaking other plugins.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.6</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix to prevent far too agressive oAuth implementation from breaking other plugins.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.5</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed a couple notices.</li>
<li>Added tracking to better understand configurations to test the plugin with.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.4</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed bug introduced with 4.2.3 that wouldn't allow saving settings.</li>
<li>Now only flushing enabled W3TC caches.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Removed Dashboard widget.</li>
<li>Improvements to comment form tracking.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix for OAuth issues, caused by other plugins that don't check for the existence of a class. Namespaced the whole thing to prevent it.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Minor bugfix.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Google Authentication now happens using OAuth. The requests have become signed as an extra security measure and tokens have become more stable, as opposed to the prior tokens used with AuthSub.</li>
<li>Added support for cross-domain tracking.</li>
<li>Fixed various small bugs.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.1.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Security fix: badly crafted comments could lead to insertion of "weird" links into comments. They'd have to pass your moderation, but still... Immediate update advised. Props to David Whitehouse and James Slater for finding it.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.1.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed bug with custom SE tracking introduced in 4.1.1.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.1.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Made plugin admin work with jQuery 1.6 and jQuery 1.4.</li>
<li>Added contextual help.</li>
<li>Improved cache flushing when using W3TC.</li>
<li>Fixed various minor other notices.</li>
<li>First stab at getting ready for full i18n compatibility.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.1</h4>

<ul>
<li><p>Added:</p>

<ul>
<li>Google Site Speed tracking, turned it on by default.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Fixed:</p>

<ul>
<li>Custom code now properly removes slashes.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.12</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:

<ul>
<li>Tons of notices in backend and front end when no settings were saved yet.</li>
<li>Set proper defaults for all variables.</li>
<li>Notice for unset categories array on custom post types.</li>
<li>Notice for unset variable.</li>
<li>Error when user is not logged in in certain corner cases.</li>
<li>Bug where $options was used but never loaded for blogroll links.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.11</h4>

<ul>
<li>Bugs fixed:

<ul>
<li>You can now disable comment form tracking properly.</li>
<li>Removed charset property from script tags to allow validation with HTML5 doctype.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.10</h4>

<ul>
<li><p>Known issues:</p>

<ul>
<li>Authentication with Google gives errors in quite a few cases. Please use the manual option to add your UA code until we find a way to reliably fix it.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Added functionality:</p>

<ul>
<li>Option to set <code>_setAllowHash</code> to false, for proper subdomain tracking and some other uses.</li>
<li>Option to add a custom string of code to the tracking, before the push string is sent out.</li>
</ul></li>
<li><p>Documentation fixes:</p>

<ul>
<li>Fixed link for <code>_setDomainName()</code>.</li>
<li>Fixed some grammatical errors (keep emailing me about those, please!)</li>
<li>Removed second comment in source output.</li>
<li>Fixed version number output in source.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.9</h4>

<ul>
<li>Code enhancements:

<ul>
<li>Updated Shopp integration to also work with the upcoming Shopp 1.1 and higher.</li>
<li>Switched from <a href="http://php.net/split">split</a> to <a href="http://php.net/explode">explode</a>, as split has been deprecated in PHP 5.3+.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>New features:

<ul>
<li>A new debug mode has been added, using the new <a href="http://analytics.blogspot.com/2010/08/new-tools-to-debug-your-tracking-code.html">ga_debug.js</a>. Along with this you can now enable Firebug Lite, so you can easily see the output from the debug script in each browser. Admins only, of course.</li>
<li>A list of modules has been added to the right sidebar, to allow easy navigation within the settings page.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.8</h4>

<ul>
<li>Reverted double quote change from 4.0.7 because it was causing bigger issues.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.7</h4>

<ul>
<li>Bugs fixed in this release:

<ul>
<li>Changed access level from "edit_users" to "manage_options" so super-admins in an multi site environment would be able to access.</li>
<li>Not a real bug but a fix nonetheless: UA ID is now trimmed on output, so spaces accidently entered in the settings screen won't prevent tracking.</li>
<li>Changed double quotes in link tracking output to single quotes to resolve incompatibilities with several plugins.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.6</h4>

<ul>
<li>Bugs fixed in this release:

<ul>
<li>Sanitizing relative URL's could go wrong on some blogs installed in subdirectories.</li>
<li>Comment form tracking only worked for posts, not for pages, and would sometimes cause other issues. Patch by <a href="http://blog.milandinic.com/">Milan Dinić</a>.</li>
<li>Settings page: now correctly hiding internal links to track as outbound block when outbound link tracking is disabled.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Code sanitization:

<ul>
<li>Hardcoded the <a href="http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/gaJS/gaJSApiBasicConfiguration.html#_gat.GA_Tracker_._setCustomVar">scope for custom variables</a> to prevent that from possibly going wrong.</li>
<li>Improved method of determining whether current user should be tracked or not.</li>
<li>Added plugin version number in script branding comment, and moved branding comment to within CDATA section to assist in debugging, even when people use W3TC or another form of code minification.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Documentation fixes:

<ul>
<li>Updated custom variable order in settings panel to reflect order of tracking. You can now determine their index key by counting down, first checked box is index 1, second 2, etc.</li>
<li>Ignored users dropdown now correctly reflects that ignoring subcribers and up means ignoring ALL logged in users.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.5</h4>

<ul>
<li>New features in this release:

<ul>
<li>Added a simple check to see if the UA code, when entered manually, matches a basic pattern of UA-1234567-12.</li>
<li>Added integration with <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/w3-total-cache/">W3 Total Cache</a> and <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-super-cache/">WP Super Cache</a>. The page cache is now automatically cleared after updating settings. Caching is recommended for all WordPress users, as faster page loads improve tracking reliability and W3 Total Cache is our recommended caching plugin.</li>
<li>Added the option to enter a manual location for ga.js, allowing you to host it locally should you wish to.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Bugs fixed:

<ul>
<li>Fixed implementation of _anonymizeIp, it now correctly anonymizes IP's by setting <a href="http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/gaJS/gaJSApi_gat.html#_gat._anonymizeIp">_gat._anonymizeIp</a>.</li>
<li>Increased request timeout time for Google Analytics authentication from 10 to 20 seconds, for slow hosts (if this fixes it for you, your hosting is probably not really good, consider another WordPress host).</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Documentation fixes:

<ul>
<li>Added a note about profiles with the same UA code to the Analytics Profile selection.</li>
<li>The profile selection dropdown now shows the UA code after the profile name too.</li>
<li>Updated the <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/screenshots/">screenshots</a> and the <a href="http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/google-analytics-for-wordpress/faq/">FAQ</a> for this plugin.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.4</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix for stupid boolean mistake in 4.0.3.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>New features in this release:

<ul>
<li>Added versioning to the options array, to allow for easy addition of options.</li>
<li>Added an option to enable comment form tracking (as this loads jQuery), defaults to on.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Bugs fixed:

<ul>
<li>If you upgraded from before 4.0 to 4.0.2 you might have an empty value for ignore_userlevel in some edge cases, this is now fixed.</li>
<li>Custom search engines were loaded after trackPageview, this was wrong as shown <a href="http://code.google.com/intl/sr/apis/analytics/docs/tracking/asyncMigrationExamples.html#SearchEngines">by these docs</a>, now fixed.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Old settings from versions below 4.0 are now properly sanitized and inherited (slaps forehead about simplicity of fix).</li>
<li>New features in this release:

<ul>
<li>Link sanitization added: relative links will be rewritten to absolute, so /out/ becomes <a href="http://example.com/out/" rel="nofollow">http://example.com/out/</a> and is tracked properly.</li>
<li>Added a feature to track and label internal links as outbound clicks, for instance /out/ links.</li>
<li>Added tracking for mailto: links.</li>
<li>Added a filter for text-widgets, all links in those widgets are now tagged too.</li>
<li>Added support for <a href="http://code.google.com/apis/analytics/docs/gaJS/gaJSApi_gat.html#_gat._anonymizeIp">_anonymizeIp</a>.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Bugs fixed in this release:

<ul>
<li>Made sure all content filters don't run when the current user is ignored because of his user level.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix for when you have only 1 site in a specific Analytics profile.</li>
</ul>

<h4>4.0</h4>

<ul>
<li>NOTE WHEN UPGRADING: you'll have to reconfigure the plugin so it can fully support all the new features!</li>
<li>Complete rewrite of the codebase</li>
<li>Switched to the new asynchronous event tracking model</li>
<li>Switched link tracking to an event tracking model, because of this change removed 5 settings from the settings panel that were no longer needed</li>
<li>Implemented custom variable tracking to track:

<ul>
<li>On the session level: whether the user is logged in or not.</li>
<li>On the page level: the current posts's author, category, tags, year of publication and post type.</li>
</ul></li>
<li>Added Google Analytics API integration, so you can easily select a site to track.</li>
<li>E-Commerce integration, tracking transactions, support for WP E-Commerce and Shopp.</li>
<li>Much much more: check out <a href="http://yoast.com/google-analytics-wordpress-v4/">the release post</a>.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.2.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added 0 result search tracking inspired by <a href="http://www.epikone.com/blog/2009/09/08/tracking-ero-result-searches-in-google-analytics/">Justin Cutroni's post</a>.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.2.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fix to the hashtag redirect so it actually works in all cases.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.2.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Slight change to RSS URL tagging, now setting campaign to post name, and behaving better when not using rewritten URL's.</li>
<li>Two patches by <a href="http://www.leewillis.co.uk">Lee Willis</a>:

<ul>
<li>Made some changes so the entire plugin works fine with .co.uk, .co.za etc domains.</li>
<li>Made sure internal blogroll links aren't tagged as external clicks.</li>
</ul></li>
</ul>

<h4>3.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added option to add tracking to add tracking to login / register pages, so you can track new signups (under Advanced settings).</li>
<li>Added beta option to track Google image search as a search engine, needs more testing to make sure it works.</li>
<li>Fixed a bug in the extra search engine tracking implementation.</li>
<li>Removed redundant "More Info" section from readme.txt.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.1.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Stupid typo that caused warnings.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added 404 tracking as described <a href="http://www.google.com/support/googleanalytics/bin/answer.py?hl=en&#38;answer=86927">here</a>.</li>
<li>Optimized the tracking script, if extra search engine tracking is disabled it'll be a lot smaller now.</li>
<li>Various code optimizations to prevent PHP notices and removal of redundant code.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.0.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Removed no longer needed code to add config page that caused PHP warnings.</li>
</ul>

<h4>3.0</h4>

<ul>
<li>Major backend overhaul, using new Yoast backend class.</li>
<li>Added ability to automatically redirect non hashtagged campaign URLs to hashtagged campaign URL's when setAllowAnchor is set to true (if you don't get it, forget about it, you might need it but don't need to worry)</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.9.5</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed a bug with the included RSS, which came up when multiple Yoast plugins were installed.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.9.4</h4>

<ul>
<li>Changed to the new Changelog design.</li>
<li>Removed pre 2.6 compatibility code, plugin now requires WP 2.6 or higher.</li>
<li>Small changes to the admin screen.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.9.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added a new option for RSS link tagging, which allows you to tag your RSS feed links with RSS campaign variables. When you've set campaign variables to use # instead of ?, this will adhere to that setting too. Thanks to <a href="http://rebelic.nl/">Timan Rebel</a> for the idea and code.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.9.2:</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added a check to see whether the wp_footer() call is in footer.php.</li>
<li>Added a message to the source when tracking code is left out because user is logged in as admin.</li>
<li>Added option to segment logged in users.</li>
<li>Added try - catch to script lines like in new Google Analytics scripts.</li>
<li>Fixed bug in warning when no UA code is entered.</li>
<li>Prevent link tracking when admin is logged in and admin tracking is disabled.</li>
<li>Now prevents parsing of non http and https link.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.9</h4>

<ul>
<li>Re arranged admin panel to have "standard" and "advanced" settings.</li>
<li>Added domain tracking.</li>
<li>Added fix for double onclick parameter, as suggested <a href="http://wordpress.org/support/topic/241757">here</a>.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.8</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added the option to add setAllowAnchor to the tracking code, allowing you to track campaigns with # instead of ?.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.7</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added option to select either header of footer position.</li>
<li>Added new AdSense integration options.</li>
<li>Removed now unneeded adsense tracking script.</li>
</ul>

<p>= 2.6.6=
* Fixed settings link.</p>

<h4>2.6.5</h4>

<ul>
<li>added Ozh admin menu icon and settings link.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.6.4</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixes for 2.7.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.6.3</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed bug that didn't allow saving of outbound clicks from comments string.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.6</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed incompatibility with WP 2.6.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.5.4</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed an issue with pluginpath being used globally.</li>
<li>Changed links to <a href="http://yoast.com/">new domain</a>.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.2</h4>

<ul>
<li>Switched to the new tracking code.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.1</h4>

<ul>
<li>Made sure tracking was disabled on preview pages.</li>
</ul>

<h4>2.0</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added AdSense tracking.</li>
</ul>

<h4>1.5</h4>

<ul>
<li>Added option to enable admin tracking, off by default.</li>
</ul>";s:3:"faq";s:155:"<p>For all frequently asked questions, and their answers, check the <a href="https://www.monsterinsights.com/docs/">MonsterInsights Knowledge base</a>.</p>";}s:17:"short_description";s:113:"Connect Google Analytics with WordPress by adding your Google Analytics tracking code. Get the stats that matter.";s:13:"download_link";s:79:"https://downloads.wordpress.org/plugin/google-analytics-for-wordpress.5.5.4.zip";s:4:"tags";a:19:{s:9:"analytics";s:9:"analytics";s:19:"analytics-dashboard";s:19:"analytics dashboard";s:9:"ecommerce";s:9:"ecommerce";s:18:"ecommerce-tracking";s:18:"ecommerce tracking";s:2:"ga";s:2:"ga";s:6:"google";s:6:"google";s:16:"google-analytics";s:16:"google analytics";s:25:"google-analytics-by-yoast";s:25:"Google Analytics by Yoast";s:26:"google-analytics-dashboard";s:26:"google analytics dashboard";s:23:"google-analytics-widget";s:23:"google analytics widget";s:16:"monster-insights";s:16:"monster insights";s:15:"monsterinsights";s:15:"monsterinsights";s:10:"statistics";s:10:"statistics";s:5:"stats";s:5:"stats";s:8:"tracking";s:8:"tracking";s:19:"universal-analytics";s:19:"universal analytics";s:26:"universal-google-analytics";s:26:"universal google analytics";s:9:"web-stats";s:9:"web stats";s:5:"yoast";s:5:"Yoast";}s:11:"donate_link";s:53:"http://www.wpbeginner.com/wpbeginner-needs-your-help/";s:5:"icons";a:3:{s:3:"svg";s:69:"//ps.w.org/google-analytics-for-wordpress/assets/icon.svg?rev=1396188";s:2:"2x";s:77:"//ps.w.org/google-analytics-for-wordpress/assets/icon-256x256.png?rev=1396188";s:2:"1x";s:77:"//ps.w.org/google-analytics-for-wordpress/assets/icon-128x128.png?rev=1396188";}}s:15:"nextgen-gallery";O:8:"stdClass":22:{s:4:"name";s:42:"NextGEN Gallery - WordPress Gallery Plugin";s:4:"slug";s:15:"nextgen-gallery";s:7:"version";s:6:"2.1.62";s:6:"author";s:45:"<a href="https://www.imagely.com">Imagely</a>";s:14:"author_profile";s:39:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/alexrabe";s:12:"contributors";a:2:{s:10:"photocrati";s:41:"https://profiles.wordpress.org/photocrati";s:7:"imagely";s:0:"";}s:8:"requires";s:5:"4.0.0";s:6:"tested";s:5:"4.7.0";s:13:"compatibility";a:0:{}s:6:"rating";d:66;s:11:"num_ratings";s:4:"1160";s:7:"ratings";a:5:{i:5;s:3:"549";i:4;s:3:"104";i:3;s:2:"57";i:2;s:2:"48";i:1;s:3:"402";}s:10:"downloaded";i:16414158;s:12:"last_updated";s:21:"2016-12-15 4:52pm GMT";s:5:"added";s:10:"2007-04-23";s:8:"homepage";s:65:"https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/nextgen-gallery/";s:8:"sections";a:5:{s:11:"description";s:4365:"<h4>WordPress Gallery Plugin</h4>

<p>NextGEN Gallery has been the industry's standard <strong>WordPress gallery plugin</strong> since 2007 and continues to receive over 1.5 million new downloads per year. It's great for general use, but powerful enough for the most demanding photographers, visual artists, and imaging professionals.</p>

<p>On the back end, NextGEN offers a complete WordPress gallery management system with the ability to batch upload, import meta data, add/delete/rearrange/sort images, edit thumbnails, group galleries into albums, and more.</p>

<p>On the front end, the free version of NextGEN provides two main display styles (slideshows and thumbnail galleries) and two album styles (compact and extended), all of which come with a wide array of options for controlling size, style, timing, transitions, controls, lightbox effects, and more.</p>

<p>Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/">NextGEN WordPress Gallery Plugin features.</a></p>

<p><strong>Demos</strong><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-thumbnail-gallery/">Basic Thumbnail Gallery Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-slideshow-gallery/">Basic Slideshow Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-compact-album/">Basic Compact Album</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/basic-extended-album/">Basic List Album</a><br /></p>

<p><strong>INTRODUCING NEXTGEN GALLERY PRO.</strong> NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro are premium WordPress gallery plugin extensions for NextGEN Gallery that add new gallery displays, lightboxes, ecommerce, proofing, and pro support. Learn more about <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/">NextGEN Plus and NextGEN Pro plugin features.</a></p>

<p><strong>Demos</strong><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-mosaic-gallery/">Pro Mosaic Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-masonry-gallery/">Pro Masonry Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-filmstrip-gallery/">Pro Filmstrip Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-film-gallery/">Pro Film Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-slideshow-gallery/">Pro Slideshow Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-thumbnail-gallery/">Pro Thumbnail Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-blogstyle-gallery/">Pro Blog Style Gallery</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-grid-album/">Pro Grid Albums</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-list-album/">Pro List Album</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-lightbox-demo/">Pro Lightbox Demo</a> (full screen and responsive with commenting, social sharing, and deep linking for individual images)<br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-proofing-demo/">Pro Proofing Demo</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin/pro-ecommerce-demo/">Pro Ecommerce Demo</a><br /></p>

<h4>About Imagely</h4>

<p>NextGEN Gallery is maintained by Imagely. We're the WordPress photography experts. In addition to NextGEN Gallery, NextGEN Plus, and NextGEN Pro, we also make Genesis WordPress themes for photographers, provide managed WordPress hosting for photographers, and run the WordPress Photography Podcast.</p>

<p>Learn more or connect with us:<br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/">Imagely Website</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-photography-themes/">Genesis WordPress Themes for Photographers</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/hosting/">Managed WordPress Hosting for Photographers</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/podcast/">The WordPress Photography Podcast</a><br />
*<a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a><br />
*<a href="https://twitter.com/imagely">Imagely on Twitter</a><br />
*<a href="https://facebook.com/getimagely">Imagely on Facebook</a><br />
*<a href="https://instagram.com/imagely">Imagely on Instagram</a><br /></p>";s:12:"installation";s:971:"<p>INSTALLATION: The easiest way to enjoy NextGEN Gallery is to login to you WordPress dashboard, go to Plugins &#62;&#62; Add New, search for NextGEN Gallery, and click to install. You can also download the zip file from this page and upload it from the Plugins &#62;&#62; Add New &#62; Upload page.</p>

<p>HOW TO USE: Just go to a page or post and click the NextGEN Gallery icon. From our Attach to Post interface, you can create, manage, customize, and display your galleries. You can also manage your galleries and gallery settings from the central options area under the "Gallery" tab on your dashboard menu.</p>

<p>DOCUMENTATION: See <a href="https://www.imagely.com/docs/nextgen-gallery/">NextGEN Gallery Documentation</a>.</p>

<p>That's it ... have fun! For more information, feel free to visit the official website for the NextGEN Gallery <a href="https://www.imagely.com/wordpress-gallery-plugin">WordPress Gallery Plugin</a>.</p>

	</li>

		<a href='//ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/screenshot-7.png?rev=1537920' title='Click to view full-size screenshot 7'>			<img class='screenshot' src='//ps.w.org/nextgen-gallery/assets/screenshot-7.png?rev=1537920' alt='nextgen-gallery screenshot 7' />

	</li>

</ol>";s:9:"changelog";s:54088:"<h4>V2.1.62 - 12.15.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Typo in notice for launching the gallery wizard</li>
<li>Fixed:   The ability to dismiss the gallery wizard notice</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.61 - 12.14.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Gallery creation wizard for new users</li>
<li>Fixed:   Shortcodes in widgets not getting substituted in Divi</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that NGG placeholder text doesn't get styled incorrectly by other themes</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various thickbox issues on custom post type pages</li>
<li>Fixed:   Hide IGW placeholder images in Yoast feed</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.60 - 11.22.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Secured: Ensure that only .css files can be edited using Styles tab</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.59 - 11.22.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Secured: Ability to customize CSS Styles</li>
<li>Changed: readme.txt improvements</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WordPress 4.7.0</li>
<li>Fixed:   IGW-inserted tagclouds are incorrect</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.57 - 11.14.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Secured: Custom Styles may only be written to specific directories</li>
<li>Secured: SQL injection vulnerability for gallery names</li>
<li>Changed: Display type icons are now clickable in the Insert Gallery Window</li>
<li>Changed: Include backup image files when coping/moving a gallery</li>
<li>Changed: Show gallery name in upload notification</li>
<li>Changed: Added placeholder text to gallery name field on Add Gallery / Upload Images page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Custom sortorder not preserved in shortcode</li>
<li>Fixed:   Shortcodes added via Insert Gallery Window displayed as []</li>
<li>Fixed:   Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'replace' of undefined</li>
<li>Fixed:   Use of deprecated Yoast SEO (aka WPSEO) filter</li>
<li>Fixed:   Conflict with Easy Digital Downloads</li>
<li>Fixed:   Misc invalid HTML tags in admin pages (thanks to kniebremser)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Change display:hidden to visibility:hidden in various places</li>
<li>Fixed:   Escaping of quotes in gallery titles and urls</li>
<li>Fixed:   Untranslatable strings</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.56 - 10.27.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Shortcode parsing was affecting third-party shortcodes</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.54 - 10.25.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added php docblock directives for code hinting/completion</li>
<li>NEW:     Display types can have aliases</li>
<li>NEW:     Visual Shortcodes</li>
<li>Changed: Now uses gulp for package compilation &#38; JS/CSS minification</li>
<li>Changed: Updated Freemius SDK to 1.2.1</li>
<li>Fixed:   Extraneous backslashes being added to gallery titles &#38; descriptions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Import folder 'gallery title' field wasn't being used for new gallery titles</li>
<li>Fixed:   Settings reset will now redirect to /wp-admin/ to avoid potential activation-related errors</li>
<li>Fixed:   Table columns cache becomes out of date between versions</li>
<li>Fixed:   Various issues with shortcodes when used in widgets</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warnings caused by calls to non-existent module package files</li>
<li>Fixed:   nextgen_admin's jquery-ui breaking Elegant Themes admin pages</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.50 - 08.30.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to open galleries within albums using a lightbox</li>
<li>Changed: Increased freemius opt-in to 100%</li>
<li>Changed: Tamara Lackey's biography on the overview page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Images not responsive for all display types</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with the Imagely Lightroom plugin</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed Pope tests folder</li>
<li>Fixed:   Maximum function nesting level fatal error when displaying two or more albums</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure Insert Gallery Window background stays white</li>
<li>Fixed:   PHP warning for C_NGG_Lightbox class using incompatible constructor</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.49 - 07.26.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Add a "Default" template option to override ATP settings when a global setting is used</li>
<li>NEW:     Added "generic" error reporting back during image upload.</li>
<li>NEW:     Added notice for deprecating PHP 5.2</li>
<li>NEW:     Option to display child gallery and album descriptions when viewing albums</li>
<li>Changed: ATP preview images are smaller with tighter margins to show more images</li>
<li>Changed: Content of Upgrade to Pro page</li>
<li>Changed: New NextGEN Overview page</li>
<li>Changed: Replicate gallery name sanitation of NG legacy for gallery paths</li>
<li>Fixed:   Resolved all found PHP warnings/notices/deprecations and strict errors</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility on Windows servers with network mounted document roots</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure EXIF meta data is loaded from the appropriate exif_data array instead of exif_array</li>
<li>Fixed:   Gallery Settings toggle not functioning</li>
<li>Fixed:   Uploading breaking when thumbnail or image resizing fails due to lack of specific format support for image libraries</li>
<li>Fixed:   Warning generated in nggallery.php checking useMediaRSS option</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.46 - 06.23.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Remove inner nextgen-gallery folder due to build issue</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.45 - 06.22.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Freemius assets should not be minified</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.44 - 06.22.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     "Add Gallery" button added next to "Add Media" button on Create/Edit Post screen</li>
<li>NEW:     IGW placeholder images are watermarked</li>
<li>NEW:     Added API for communicating with Lightroom plugin</li>
<li>NEW:     Gulp build system</li>
<li>NEW:     Added "ngg_igw_placeholder_line_2_settings" and "ngg_igw_placeholder_line_1_settings" filters</li>
<li>NEW:     Added "ngg_settings_during_image_generation" filter to adjust image generation</li>
<li>NEW:     Added "ngg_before_save_thumbnail" filter for image manipulation abilities</li>
<li>NEW:     Added the ability to apply GD filters during image generation</li>
<li>NEW:     Integrated with WordPress SEO sitemaps to show include NGG images in image counts</li>
<li>Changed: Links to manage a gallery after it's been created don't appear in the IGW</li>
<li>Fixed:   Freemius code shouldn't be minified</li>
<li>Fixed:   When a datamapper entity is saved, it's corresponding cache should be cleared</li>
<li>Fixed:   IGW placeholder images aren't used by WordPress SEO's OpenGraph analysis</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.43 - 05.25.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added Freemius integration</li>
<li>NEW:     Added actions actions ngg_updated_image_meta, ngg_recovered_image, ngg_generated_image, ngg_moved_images, and ngg_copied_images</li>
<li>NEW:     Added patch from WPML copyping ATP galleries to new language pages when duplicating a page to a new language</li>
<li>Changed: Moved 'ngg_delete_picture' action to before the image has been removed</li>
<li>Changed: Now prevent maximum_entity_count from being set to 0 or lower in Other Options</li>
<li>Changed: Updated "Roots" relative url support to re-branded "Soil" relative url</li>
<li>Changed: Updated branding so all publicly visible instances of "Photocrati" are now "Imagely"</li>
<li>Changed: Upgraded FontAwesome to 4.6.1</li>
<li>Fixed:   Album breadcrumbs when used with legacy templates</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with added WP role objects without a remove_cap() method</li>
<li>Fixed:   Default watermark setting causing images to be watermarked by text even though "image" is shown chosen on "Other Options"</li>
<li>Fixed:   Navigating to albums with UTF8 characters in their name</li>
<li>Fixed:   Replaced use of get_currentuserinfo() with wp_get_current_user()</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.33 - 04.25.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with themes and plugins which enqueue underscore.js in the head of the document</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that shutter reloaded can find it's image assets</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.31 - 04.05.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added constant NGG_SCRIPT_VERSION that is either the plugin version or rand() should SCRIPT_DEBUG be on</li>
<li>NEW:     Added warning when saving galleries and refuse to automatically delete galleries with one or more "../" in their path.</li>
<li>Changed: ATP slug field disallow several characters (spaces, ?, &#124;, &#38;, [, ]) by replacing them with dashes as they are typed</li>
<li>Changed:     Made get_static_url() look in the WP_CONTENT/ngg/(module_name)/static directory for CSS/JS overrides</li>
<li>Fixed:   Bug introduced in 2.1.24 allowing gallery paths &#38; slugs to contain spaces; galleries must be "saved" once to correct them</li>
<li>Fixed:   Compatibility with WPML String Translation when uploading images without title or description</li>
<li>Fixed:   Made get_image_url() encode gallery directory names 'because%this%is' a valid directory</li>
<li>Fixed:   Manage Galleries &#62; Search results not saving when edited</li>
<li>Fixed:   Provided imagebrowser legacy templates not using AJAX pagination when enabled</li>
<li>Fixed:   Resource manager breaking the layout of the Multisite Plugin Activation page</li>
<li>Fixed:   Static url generation when the nextgen-gallery directory is a symlink outside of the WordPress roots</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.27 - 03.16.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:    Formatting issues with changelog</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.26 - 03.15.2016</h4>

<ul>
<li>Fixed:    Removed unnecessary whitespace from "Related images" template that caused issues with some themes</li>
<li>Fixed:    Detection of parents from grand-child-albums when generating breadcrumbs</li>
<li>Fixed:    C_Router-&#62;initialize() generating warnings with WP-CLI or the WP-CLI-Cron</li>
<li>Fixed:    Added Roots-theme relative-url support to C_MVC_Router-&#62;get_static_url()</li>
<li>Fixed:    nggdb::get_unique_slug() not generating unique slugs</li>
<li>Fixed:    Album breadcrumbs CSS compatibility with certain themes</li>
<li>Fixed:    C_Gallery-&#62;validation() not working properly when sanitizing gallery title using UTF-8</li>
<li>Fixed:    NGG's cross-frame-communication cookies not being purged</li>
<li>Fixed:    Updated C_Dynamic_Thumbnails_Manager-&#62;get_uri_from_params() with user-submitted patch</li>
<li>Fixed:    Updated C_CustomPost_DataMapper_Driver-&#62;_save_entity() with user-submitted patch</li>
<li>Fixed:    Cleaned up overview.php's readability and removed some now-long-unused code from legacy's ajax.php</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.23 - 01.05.2015</h4>

<ul>

</ul>

<h4>V2.1.18 - 12.21.2015</h4>

<ul>
<li>NEW:     Added text domain and domain path to plugin header</li>
<li>NEW:     Add the ability to specify gallery title with import_gallery_from_fs() method</li>
<li>NEW:     Swedish (sv_SE) translation (thanks Anders O Johansson)</li>
<li>Changed: Updated FontAwesome to version 4.5</li>
<li>Changed: Handle for bundled version select2 is now called 'ngg_select2'</li>
<li>Fixed:   Removed redundant translatable strings (thanks Rene Wolf)</li>
<li>Fixed:   Loading non-WOFF fonts on IIS servers</li>
<li>Fixed:   Attempt to load non-existing minified translation files for Plupload</li>
<li>Fixed:   Order direction not honored on Manage Galleries page</li>
<li>Fixed:   _NGG_Galleries_List_Table compatibility with WordPress 4.3+</li>
<li>Fixed:   Double-UTF8-encoding of image metadata</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don't use interframe communication outside of the Insert Gallery Window</li>
<li>Fixed:   Problem deleting interframe communication cookies</li>
</ul>

<h4>V2.1.15 - 09.09.2015</h4>

<ul>
<li>Secured: Image uploads</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don't use esc_attr_e() to prevent translation issues</li>
<li>Fixed:   Ensure that deleting a gallery doesn't delete anything it shouldn't</li>
<li>Fixed:   get_gallery_abspath() should return NULL if the path doesn't exist</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Secured: Image uploads</li>
<li>Fixed:   Don't use esc_attr_e() to present translation issues</li>
</ul>

<ul>

</ul>
